question_text: Do you have a cell phone?
Is it a smartphone with apps and access to the internet?
Do you feel you can contact your parent(s) in a timely manner when you need to during the school day?
Do you bring a phone to school?
If you bring a phone to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
If you bring a phone to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
Do you bring a tablet to school?
If you bring a tablet to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
If you bring a tablet to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
Do you bring a laptop to school?
If you bring a laptop to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
If you bring a laptop to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
Do you bring a smartwatch to school?
If you bring a smartwatch to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
If you bring a smartwatch to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
Do you bring another device to school?
Other Device:
If you bring the device to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
If you bring the device to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
On an average school day (from when you arrive at school to when you leave), how much time do you spend using your phone?  (in hours)
On a scale of 1-5, please rate your agreement with this statement: “I feel worried about missing out on things when I don’t have access to my phone.” (1 = Strongly disagree to 5 = Strongly agree)
Do you have a job?

If you have a job outside of school, around how many times does your boss/supervisor contact you through your mobile phone each week during the school day?

Number of times per week:

During a single school day, around how many times do your parents contact you through your mobile phone? 

Number of times per day:
Does your school have a phone policy?
Under your school’s phone policy, when are students allowed to use their phones at school? Select all that apply.
How does your school restrict access to phones?  Select all that apply.
How satisfied are you with your school’s phone policy?
How consistently do teachers and staff enforce your school's phone policy? Give your best guess.
What percentage of your classmates are using their phone when they shouldn’t be? Give your best guess.
In your opinion, should your school's phone policy be more or less restrictive than it is now?
In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience.
In general, I pay attention in class.
I feel like this school is the right place for me.
In class, I often pretend to be working when I’m not.
In school, I do just enough to get by.
I think the things I learn at school are useless.
My school is a place where…
I feel like an outsider (or left out of things).
I make friends easily.
I feel like I belong.
I feel awkward and out of place.
Other students seem to like me.
I often feel lonely.
My teachers really try to help me.
I get the emotional help and support I need from my school’s staff.
My friends really try to help me.
I can count on my friends when things go wrong.
I can talk about my problems with my teachers.
I have friends with whom I can share my joys and sorrows.
My teachers are willing to help me make decisions.
I can talk about my problems with my friends.

For each of the following statements, please select the option that best captures how you feel about your relationships with your friends at school. Think about each question carefully and be sure that you rate your friendships according to the way they are now, not according to how you want them to be.
My friends at school and I spend all our free time together.
Sometimes my friends at school and I just sit around and talk about things like school, sports, and things we like.
I get into fights with my friends at school.
If I forgot my lunch or needed a little money, my friends at school would help me out.
If other kids were bothering me, my friends at school would help me.
If I have a problem at school or at home, I can talk to my friends about it.
If my friends had to move away, I would miss them.
When I do a good job at something, my friends at school are happy for me.
How much of lunchtime do you spend talking with your friends in-person?
Do you sometimes go to the bathroom just to use your phone?
On school nights, how many hours of sleep do you usually get? (in hours)
On a scale from 1-5, how would you rate the quality of your sleep? (1 = Very bad, 5 = Very good)
In the past two weeks (14 days), on how many days have you slept poorly?

During the past 7 days, on how many days were you physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day? (Add up all the time you spent in any kind of physical activity that increased your heart rate and made you breathe hard some of the time.)

Number of days:

During the past 12 months, on how many sports teams did you play? (Count any teams run by your school or community groups.)    

Number of Teams:

During the past 30 days, on how many days did you not go to school because you felt you would be unsafe at school?

Number of Days:
For each of the following statements, please select the option that best captures how you feel.
Overall, I am happy with myself.
I have a positive attitude toward myself.
I can do a lot of things just as well as most other people.
In most ways my life is close to my ideal
I am satisfied with my life.
The conditions of my life are excellent.
Please rate your agreement with the following statements.
I feel that classmates are making fun of me.
I worry about what my classmates think of me.
I'm afraid that my classmates will not like me.
I feel that my classmates talk about me behind my back.
I feel shy around students I don't know.
I get nervous when I talk to new classmates.
I feel nervous when I'm around certain classmates.
It's hard for me to ask other classmates to play/hang out with me.
I feel shy even with classmates I know very well.
I'm afraid to invite my classmates to my house because they might say no.
In the past four weeks, how often have you experienced the following?
I have no energy for things.
I feel sad or empty.
I feel worthless.
Please rate your agreement with the following statements.
I am often accused of lying or cheating.
I fight a lot.
I can make other people do what I want.
I take things that are not mine from home, school or elsewhere.
I am restless, I cannot stay still for long.
I am constantly fidgeting or squirming.
I am easily distracted, I find it difficult to concentrate.
In recent weeks, how often have you experienced the following DURING school hours?
Someone teased you or called you names.
Someone deliberately left you out of things.
Someone threatened you.
Someone physically hurt you.
A student told lies about you in texts or online to make others not like you.
A student said online that they won’t like you unless you do what they want you to do.
Another student tried to keep others from liking you by texting or posting mean things about you.
How upsetting was it to be bullied in these ways DURING school hours?
Someone teased you or called you names.
Someone deliberately left you out of things.
Someone threatened you.
Someone physically hurt you.
A student told lies about you in texts or online to make others not like you.
A student said online that they won’t like you unless you do what they want you to do.
Another student tried to keep others from liking you by texting or posting mean things about you.
In recent weeks, how often have you experienced the following OUTSIDE OF school hours?
Someone teased you or called you names.
Someone deliberately left you out of things.
Someone threatened you.
Someone physically hurt you.
A student told lies about you in texts or online to make others not like you.
A student said online that they won’t like you unless you do what they want you to do.
Another student tried to keep others from liking you by texting or posting mean things about you.
How upsetting was it to be bullied in these ways OUTSIDE OF school hours?
Someone teased you or called you names.
Someone deliberately left you out of things.
Someone threatened you.
Someone physically hurt you.
A student told lies about you in texts or online to make others not like you.
A student said online that they won’t like you unless you do what they want you to do.
Another student tried to keep others from liking you by texting or posting mean things about you.
Please share any other thoughts you have about your school's phone policy.
Is there anything else you want to share with us?
What grade are you in?
Are you an English Language Learner (ELL)?
Do you have an Individualized Education Plan (IEP)? This is a plan or program for students with disabilities to receive special education.
What is your gender?
With which racial/ethnic groups do you identify? You can select more than one.
Overall, how would you say your school’s phone policy has changed your school?

Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] …
I have focused better in class.
I have had fewer distractions.
I have developed better social skills.
I have felt closer to my friends.
I have felt more left out or excluded.
I have felt more anxious without my phone.
I have talked to more people during lunch or breaks.
I have felt less pressure to check my phone.
I have gotten into trouble less often.
I have been involved in less social drama at school.
My grades have improved.
I have been less likely to cheat.
I have spent less time on my phone.
I have been bullied more.
I have felt less stressed.
I have used my phone more before and after school.
Nothing has really changed for me.
